title: Tucker Carlson
added: In 2018, a group of [[Antifa (United States)|antifa]] activists associated with the "Smash Racism D.C." group protested outside Carlson's [[Washington, D.C.]], home.<ref name="WaPo.Threatening">{{cite news|last=Chiu|first=Allyson|date=November 8, 2018|title='They were threatening me and my family': Tucker Carlson's home targeted by protesters|work=[[The Washington Post]]|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2018/11/08/they-were-threatening-me-my-family-tucker-carlsons-home-targeted-by-protesters/|url-status=live|access-date=January 29, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181229143955/https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2018/11/08/they-were-threatening-me-my-family-tucker-carlsons-home-targeted-by-protesters/|archive-date=December 29, 2018}}</ref> Carlson's driveway was vandalized with a spray-painted [[Anarchist symbolism|anarchist symbol]]. Police responded within minutes and the protesters were dispersed.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Fieldstadt|first1=Elisha|title=Antifa group chants outside, vandalizes Fox commentator Tucker Carlson's home|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/news/all/antifa-group-chants-outside-vandalizes-fox-commentator-tucker-carlson-s-n934131|url-status=live|access-date=January 29, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181126153143/https://www.nbcnews.com/news/all/antifa-group-chants-outside-vandalizes-fox-commentator-tucker-carlson-s-n934131|archive-date=November 26, 2018}}</ref>

title: Tucker Carlson
added: * Kurtz, Howard. [https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/lifestyle/1999/08/17/the-opinionated-journalist/4340b332-e33d-442b-b681-fbb97cffee71/ "The Opinionated Journalist,"] ''[[The Washington Post]],'' August 17, 1999.

title: Tucker Carlson
deleted: On February 10, 2021, Carlson falsely claimed that "There was no physical evidence that George Floyd was murdered by a cop." and that "The autopsy showed that George Floyd almost certainly died of a [[drug overdose]]—[[fentanyl]]".<ref name=":11">{{Cite web|last=Kiley|first=Rachel|date=2021-02-11|title=Tucker Carlson Falsely Claims That George Floyd Wasn’t Killed by Cops|url=https://www.dailydot.com/irl/tucker-carlson-george-floyd-not-killed-by-cops/|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2021-02-11|website=[[The Daily Dot]]|language=en-US}}</ref> Both the first and second autopsies of Floyd determined that he died from [[Homicide|homocide]] caused by former [[police officer]] [[Derek Chauvin]] kneeling on Floyd’s neck for more than [[Eight minutes 46 seconds|eight minutes]].<ref name=":11" /> While Floyd did have [[Drug|drugs]] in his system when he died, medical professionals determined that it was not the cause of his death.<ref name=":11" />

title: Tucker Carlson
added: * Bump, Philip. [https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2021/01/14/tucker-carlson-is-making-his-play-be-post-trump-maga-champion/ "Tucker Carlson is making his play to be the post-Trump MAGA champion"] ''[[The Washington Post]],'' January 14, 2021.

title: Tucker Carlson
added: In March 2021, Carlson criticized changes being made to the U.S. military to accommodate female soldiers, calling it a "mockery of the U.S. military". For these remarks, Carlson was criticized by military leaders.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Forgey |first1=Quint |title=Military leaders thrash Tucker Carlson after comments about female troops |url=https://www.politico.com/news/2021/03/11/military-tucker-carlson-female-troops-comments-475315 |access-date=March 12, 2021 |work=[[Politico]] |date=March 11, 2021}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Darcy |first1=Oliver |last2=Starr |first2=Barbara |title=Pentagon and senior members of military call out Tucker Carlson for mocking women serving in armed forces: His words 'don't reflect our values' |url=https://edition.cnn.com/2021/03/11/media/tucker-carlson-mocks-military-women/index.html |access-date=March 12, 2021 |work=[[CNN]] |date=March 11, 2021}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Pentagon rebukes Fox host Tucker Carlson for mocking female troops |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-56368679 |access-date=March 12, 2021 |work=[[BBC News]] |date=March 12, 2021}}</ref>

title: Tucker Carlson
added: In March 2021, Carlson criticized changes being made to the U.S. military to accommodate female soldiers, calling it a "mockery of the U.S. military", while raising the comparison that the Chinese military was becoming "more masculine". For these remarks, Carlson was criticized by military leaders.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Forgey |first1=Quint |title=Military leaders thrash Tucker Carlson after comments about female troops |url=https://www.politico.com/news/2021/03/11/military-tucker-carlson-female-troops-comments-475315 |access-date=March 12, 2021 |work=[[Politico]] |date=March 11, 2021}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Darcy |first1=Oliver |last2=Starr |first2=Barbara |title=Pentagon and senior members of military call out Tucker Carlson for mocking women serving in armed forces: His words 'don't reflect our values' |url=https://edition.cnn.com/2021/03/11/media/tucker-carlson-mocks-military-women/index.html |access-date=March 12, 2021 |work=[[CNN]] |date=March 11, 2021}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Pentagon rebukes Fox host Tucker Carlson for mocking female troops |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-56368679 |access-date=March 12, 2021 |work=[[BBC News]] |date=March 12, 2021}}</ref>

title: Tucker Carlson
deleted: In March 2021, Carlson criticized changes being made to the U.S. military to accommodate female soldiers, calling it a "mockery of the U.S. military", while raising the comparison that the Chinese military was becoming "more masculine". For these remarks, Carlson was criticized by military leaders.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Forgey |first1=Quint |title=Military leaders thrash Tucker Carlson after comments about female troops |url=https://www.politico.com/news/2021/03/11/military-tucker-carlson-female-troops-comments-475315 |access-date=March 12, 2021 |work=[[Politico]] |date=March 11, 2021}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Darcy |first1=Oliver |last2=Starr |first2=Barbara |title=Pentagon and senior members of military call out Tucker Carlson for mocking women serving in armed forces: His words 'don't reflect our values' |url=https://edition.cnn.com/2021/03/11/media/tucker-carlson-mocks-military-women/index.html |access-date=March 12, 2021 |work=[[CNN]] |date=March 11, 2021}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Pentagon rebukes Fox host Tucker Carlson for mocking female troops |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-56368679 |access-date=March 12, 2021 |work=[[BBC News]] |date=March 12, 2021}}</ref>

During the [[2021 Texas power crisis]], Carlson devoted an entire segment of his show to pin the blame on renewable energy; however, renewables played only a minor part in the crisis and Carlson made no mention of natural gas failures which played a larger role.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Fact check: Renewable energy is not to blame for the Texas energy crisis|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/fact-check-renewable-energy-not-blame-texas-energy-crisis-n1258185|access-date=2021-03-12|website=NBC News|language=en}}</ref>
